content: two-ball baby cardigan design lisbet clements the garment in the picture is size 48 cm size 0-2 months garment chest measurement 48 cm garment length 27 cm yarn 4-ply yarn requirement 50 g background colour dark blue 50 g contrast colour light blue gauge 28 sts × 38 row = 10 cm × 10 cm in st st needles 3 mm needles straight or circular 3 5 mm needles straight or circular abbreviations k knit p purl st s stitch es st st stocking stitch ws wrong side note it is really important to observe the gauge the needle sizes given in the pattern are only a guide if the stitch count measures less than 10 cm change to bigger needles if the stitch count measures more than 10 cm change to smaller needles construction the cardigan is worked from the bottom up back and forth stitches are cast off for the armholes and the fronts and back are completed separately sleeves are worked back and forth from the cuff upwards the sleeves are set in shoulders are knitted together and neck and button bands are worked last the contrast colour is continued by embroidery at the top and bottom of the button bands five buttons are needed this cardigan is given in one size only and is designed to use less than 100 g of 4-ply yarn in total 50 g of background and less than 30 g of contrast if you find yourself running out of the background colour you could work the button bands in the contrast colour there was less than 2 yards of background colour left for the pictured cardigan a real game of yarn chicken note please read the whole pattern before starting two-ball baby cardigan back+front worked back and forth using 3 mm needles and contrast colour cast on 133 sts work 1 row of 1x1 rib p1 k1 change to background colour and continue working rib until the work measures 3 5 cm change to 3 5 mm needles and st st and work the chart increasing 1 st on the first row =134 sts start the row as shown with 2 sts before the first elephant and finish the row with 2 sts in background colour after the last elephant after one line of elephants continue working stripe pattern as shown 2 r contrast colour 4 r background colour work stripes until the work measures 16 5 cm finishing with a ws row then cast off for armholes as follows k 28 sts cast off 10 sts k 58 sts cast off 10 sts k 28 sts back continue working stripes over the 58 back stitches until the work measures 24 5 cm cast off the middle 24 sts and work the shoulders 17 sts each separately on the next row cast off 2 sts on the neck side and continue straight until the work measures 27 cm leave the remaining shoulder stitches on
